caption: Token
description: The Token object contains attributes for API tokens, client tokens, and API keys used specifically for API authentication and authorization. Use this object in API activity events to represent: (1) tokens created by Identity Providers (IdPs) such as Okta API tokens or Microsoft Entra ID Application Registration client secrets, (2) generic API keys used in SaaS applications for API authentication. When to use this object: Use token when you need to represent the token used to authenticate an API request in an API activity event. When NOT to use this object: Do NOT use token for protocol-specific authentication tokens (Kerberos TGT/ST, OIDC ID/Refresh tokens, SAML assertions) - use authentication_token instead in authentication events. Do NOT use token for tracking credential lifecycle and usage patterns - use programmatic_credential instead.
name: token

created_time.description: The time that the token was created.

expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the token.

is_renewable.description: Indicates whether the token is renewable.

modified_time.description: The last time the token was updated.

name.description: The human-friendly name of a token or key, if available, such as the name from the Okta API Token API.

tenant_uid.description: The unique identifier of the tenant or organization that owns the token or key, or the tenant context in which the token is authorized for use. This is particularly relevant in multi-tenant Identity Provider scenarios where tokens are scoped to specific tenants.

type.description: The type of the token, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. This indicates whether the token is a Client Token, API Token, or one of the protocol-specific token types.

type_id.description: The normalized token type identifier. Valid values: 0 (Unknown), 1 (Ticket Granting Ticket - Kerberos), 2 (Service Ticket - Kerberos), 3 (Identity Token - OIDC), 4 (Refresh Token - OIDC), 5 (SAML Assertion), 6 (Client Token - IdP-issued), 7 (API Token - generic API keys), 99 (Other).

6.caption: Client Token
6.description: Client Token issued by an Identity Provider (IdP) for application authentication. Use this value for IdP-issued tokens used for service-to-service authentication. Examples: Microsoft Entra ID Application Registration client secrets, Okta API tokens, Auth0 Machine-to-Machine tokens. Key characteristic: These tokens are issued by Identity Providers, not by individual services.

7.caption: API Token
7.description: A generic API token or API key used for authenticating API requests. Use this value for service-specific API authentication tokens that are NOT issued by Identity Providers. Examples: REST API keys, GraphQL API keys, Stripe API keys, Twilio API keys, AWS API keys. Key characteristic: These tokens are issued by individual services/platforms, not by Identity Providers.

uid.description: The unique ID of a token or key, if available, such as the Secret ID of Entra ID Application Registration Client Secrets.

zone.description: The network zone or geographic region that the token or key is authorized to be used from. This may represent network-based access restrictions, geographic limitations, or other zone-based authorization policies. Examples include Okta's network zone restrictions or cloud provider region restrictions.
